variants.description: The c.1060G>A (p.G354R) mutation was shown to significantly reduce PINK1 kinase activity, leading to impaired mitophagy and increased neuronal cell death.
The c.1922G>A (p.R641Q) variant was associated with increased kinase activity and neurotoxicity in dopaminergic neurons.
The c.1436C>T (p.S479F) mutation enhanced LRRK2 kinase activity and promoted α-synuclein aggregation in cellular models.
The c.1606G>A (p.G536R) variant increased LRRK2 auto-phosphorylation and led to mitochondrial dysfunction in PD patient-derived neurons.
The c.661C>T (p.R221W) mutation impaired PARK2 ubiquitin ligase activity, resulting in reduced proteasomal degradation of damaged mitochondria.
The c.241G>A (p.G81R) variant enhanced α-synuclein oligomerization and increased toxicity in dopaminergic neurons.
The c.271C>T (p.R91C) mutation promoted α-synuclein fibril formation and disrupted synaptic vesicle trafficking.
The c.307G>A (p.G103R) variant increased α-synuclein aggregation and impaired lysosomal function in cellular models.
The c.109G>A (p.G37R) mutation reduced GBA enzyme activity and elevated α-synuclein levels in patient-derived fibroblasts.
The c.154G>A (p.G52R) variant impaired GBA catalytic function and increased lipid accumulation in macrophages.

Experiment Methods.result_description: Reduced PINK1 kinase activity, leading to impaired mitophagy and increased neuronal cell death.

Experiment Methods.readout_type: Quantitative ( kinase activity and α-synuclein aggregation )
Experiment Methods.result_description: Increased kinase activity and neurotoxicity in dopaminergic neurons.

Experiment Methods.materials_used: Primary neurons from PARK2 mutation carriers
Experiment Methods.readout_type: Quantitative ( proteasomal degradation of mitochondrial proteins )
Experiment Methods.result_description: Impaired PARK2 ubiquitin ligase activity, resulting in reduced proteasomal degradation of damaged mitochondria.

Experiment Methods.readout_type: Quantitative ( cell viability and α-synuclein oligomerization )
Experiment Methods.result_description: Enhanced α-synuclein oligomerization and increased toxicity in dopaminergic neurons.

Experiment Methods.readout_type: Quantitative ( GBA enzyme activity and α-synuclein levels )
Experiment Methods.result_description: Reduced GBA enzyme activity and elevated α-synuclein levels in patient-derived fibroblasts.
